fieldDefinitions.title: The human-readable title of the work
fieldDefinitions.slug: The URL slug used by Substack
fieldDefinitions.url: Full URL to the Substack post
fieldDefinitions.description: A brief summary of the work in 1–3 sentences
fieldDefinitions.author: The author of the work
fieldDefinitions.keywords: Array of thematic or conceptual keywords
fieldDefinitions.phase: The Ousia Bloom phase associated with this work

timeFelt.timestamp: ISO timestamp of when Aleksandr felt this phase
timeFelt.phase: Name of the phase at that moment

fieldDefinitions.motifMap: Symbolic elements in the piece with meaning + spatial position
fieldDefinitions.associatedMedia: Images, artwork, or media used with this piece
fieldDefinitions.generatedBy: Tool and date of metadata generation

title: The Parable of the Coal-Black Horse
description: A parable of misdirection and mistaken certainty: a farmer follows rumors and projections in search of his favorite horse, only to discover his own error through comic humiliation. A Trickster-Prophet teaching about pride, projection, and humility.
author: Aleksandr Agnitio

motifMap.meaning: The truth obscured by projection; the innocent center of misunderstanding
Fragmented perception; false signs mistaken as certainty
Evidence misread through bias; the ambiguity of signs
Humbling revelation; the quiet truth that corrects pride

associatedMedia.description: Screenshot of the Substack post as published, showing the parable text
